CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert Peterson, garage worker, Uptown and Mr. John R. Dallas, laborer, Mt. Washington, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 29, 1961, pg.7 with question: "Do you believe that Russia actually 'put a man in space'--in orbit around the earth, or do you think that it was a 'trial run' to test man and rocket, prior to an attempt to put him in actual orbit in outer space?" Mr. Robert Peterson's answer reads: "I think there may have been a trial run, but I don't think they put a man into space.  I just don't believe it."  Mr. John R. Dallas' answer reads: "I think so.  I definitely think so, because our Government doesn't deny it.  I believe that our Government has the means to view it and I believe that they have seen it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Robert Peterson wearing dark square patterned coat and cap, standing in front of store window; Portrait of John R. Dallas wearing checkered suit jacket standing in front of building
